programmes.show_description: Unwed parents, involved in a custody battle for their twins, fight over alleged stolen property. A newspaper reporter accuses his ex-girlfriend of trying to steal one of his snowboards. S10, Ep46
A woman claims her jealous ex-boyfriend got angry and drunk at a party and crashed her car on their drive home. A young woman refuses to return a washer/dryer. S10, Ep47
The Judge questions two women about their romantic choices when horrible allegations of abuse come to light. S23, Ep11
A food deliveryman with a handful of Burger King calls 911 after allegedly being bitten by a client's dog. S23, Ep12
After two young women purchase a mobile home for 4K, the previous owner accidentally burns it down before they can move in. S23, Ep13
A teenager pays a co-worker $50 for a car and then breaches agreement for future payments. S23, Ep14
A man admits that he put all the responsibility of finding a new tenant on his pregnant roommate's shoulders; he sues her for damages. S23, Ep15
Alleged slander, toxic trash and a major disagreement over property lines come into play when neighbours go after each other. S23, Ep16
A gambler wins a seven-day cruise, but makes the very wrong choice in travelling companions and claims she was left stranded in Miami. S23, Ep17
When peacocks attack and dogs get territorial, angry neighbours demand justice. A single mother denies hiding raw fish and other perishables in her ex-roommate's house. S10, Ep41
A child's playhouse is pushed over a fence and allegedly hits a parked car. Ex-lovers, who suspect each other of cheating, wage war over a hefty car loan. S10, Ep43
A mother and daughter vanish whilst out shopping. When the girl turns up dead, the mother is the initial suspect. But who really killed her? S6, Ep30
Lead singer of the band 'Bob Kuban and the In Men', Walter Scott, wrote 'The Cheater' a song that rang true in later life. S7, Ep1
Innovative, value-for-money products brought directly to you at home. Shop 'til you drop whilst avoiding the hustle and bustle of the High Street.
Steve Keogh discusses a murder investigation with no body, a love triangle, and forensic clues. The case is solved with old-fashioned detective work. S1, Ep17
Detective Keogh and SIO Terry Crompton discuss the 2016 murder of Yang Liu, whose torso was found in a suitcase. S1, Ep18
Innovative, value-for-money products brought directly to you at home. Shop 'til you drop whilst avoiding the hustle and bustle of the High Street.
In a case that captured worldwide attention, the Menendez brothers were tried and convicted of murdering their parents, Jose and Kitty Menendez. S36, Ep21
A mother and daughter vanish whilst out shopping. When the girl turns up dead, the mother is the initial suspect. But who really killed her? S6, Ep30
Lead singer of the band 'Bob Kuban and the In Men', Walter Scott, wrote 'The Cheater' a song that rang true in later life. S7, Ep1
Eight years after the murder of a woman in a Pizza Hut restaurant, a seemingly innocent man confesses to the crime. Was he the real killer? S7, Ep2
Top-notch forensic science helps solve real crimes. Investigators take to the water to determine who was responsible for a terrible attack on two boys out on a fishing trip. S7, Ep3
With the help of the SIO Paul Withers, Detective Inspector Steve Keogh leads us through the complex investigation of the 2016 murder of Michael Keen. S1, Ep19
With the help of SIO Pete Simm, Detective Inspector Steve Keogh leads us through the multi-layered investigation of the 2012 murder of beloved Christopher Proctor. S1, Ep20
Well-known beauty executive Fabio Sementilli was sitting by his swimming pool when he was brutally stabbed to death. S36, Ep22
When a prostitute is brutally murdered, her body is dumped in a waterway. Investigators find a tiny clue which could point to the killer. S7, Ep4
A high school student was raped, murdered and dumped in a field, but the main suspect had a strong alibi. S7, Ep5
Investigators make history by performing DNA tests on cat hairs found at the scene of a bloody murder. S7, Ep7
An outbreak of food poisoning led investigators to a religious cult that was determined to overthrow the government. S7, Ep8
A woman claims she was falsely arrested for domestic violence and explains how her boyfriend got his scratches. S23, Ep18
When alcohol and alleged idiocy come into play, the Judge reminds litigants that lunch is right around the corner if they can't prove their case. S23, Ep19
A man's story changes when he describes damages to his beloved Harley and the allegedly shoddy care taken by a mechanic. S23, Ep20
After receiving a large settlement check, a woman purchases breast augmentation surgery and is cared for by a friend; they fight over a loan. S23, Ep21
A woman admits that she promised to pay for her incarcerated son's property damage; when she changes her mind, her Harley is towed by his ex-roommate. S23, Ep22
A couple shell out $4,000 to a man for a mobile home only to discover that he doesn't even own the trailer and has allegedly sold it more than once. S23, Ep23
When the Judge realises that a fight over a used Mercedes Benz lacks critical evidence, she reminds lax litigants that she has better things to do. S23, Ep24
A man is sued for damages after allegedly spraying Silly String all over a limousine during his birthday celebration. A mother claims her teenager was tricked. S10, Ep48
A student claims she has a history of violence with her ex-fiancé and accuses him of vandalising her car. A man refuses to pay a friend back. S10, Ep49
After a domestic violence incident, unwed parents dispute their agreement to trade child support for the use of a car. A woman claims a mother of four took advantage of her. S10, Ep50
Family drama escalates when an argument over the payment of a cab fare turns violent. A woman demands a refund for an allegedly 'fake and broken' Ms Pacman arcade game. S10, Ep51
Road rage at a middle school begins with a shouting match and allegedly ends in a hit-and-run and thousands in damages. S10, Ep52
Ex-fiancées, who have a child together, accuse each other of cheating and fight for custody of an entertainment centre. S10, Ep53
An angry grandmother spends a week in jail after a visit to see her grandson turns violent. An intoxicated woman catches her boyfriend cheating on her. S10, Ep54
A woman claims she was falsely arrested for domestic violence and explains how her boyfriend got his scratches. S23, Ep18

Innovative, value-for-money products brought directly to you at home. Shop 'til you drop whilst avoiding the hustle and bustle of the High Street.
The investigation of a hit and run incident, in which a child was killed, leads to a convincing video reconstruction of the moment of impact. S5, Ep19
When a doctor is accused of assaulting two female patients, his DNA fails to match the crimes. S6, Ep18
When the wife of a farmer goes missing, remarkably, the study of tree ring growth helps investigators to solve the case. S6, Ep20
When a woman is convicted of her husband's murder, her son goes to great lengths to prove her innocence. S6, Ep21
Innovative, value-for-money products brought directly to you at home... Shop 'til you drop whilst avoiding the hustle and bustle of the High Street.
Arsenic was found in the blood of a dead woman who was due to testify in court. Who would go to such lengths to get her out of the picture? S10, Ep21
This is the story of two brothers who hit the big time on America's porn market, but their rocky relationship ended in disaster. S6, Ep23
Prominent LA therapist Amie Harwick was murdered in February 2020. For the first time, the man who tried to save her opens up about what happened. S36, Ep18
Las Vegas investigative reporter Jeff German was a local legend, but in September 2022, it was the reporter making headlines. S36, Ep19
This episode looks at the intriguing case of Kouri Richins, a children's book author who finds herself at the centre of a murder investigation following the death of her husband. S36, Ep20
Florida, 1995, an elderly lady and her carer are murdered in a shocking home invasion. Earl Linebaugh and Melissa Harris are found guilty and sentenced to life with no parole. S5, Ep4
Baby Dylan was three-months-old when his mother, Alexandra Tobias shook him to death. She claims it was an accident but was found guilty of second degree murder. S5, Ep5
In 1997, eight-year-old Jamie Lavis went missing after playing outside, near Manchester. Family Liaison Officer Asif Hussain was assigned to support the family. S1, Ep1
Christopher and Amanda Birks appeared to have a happy family life. When their house caught fire, Christopher and the children escaped, but Amanda didn't. S1, Ep2
Punchy reality show about a female judge that has made a real impact on the American justice system. Judge Judy is real, honest and keen to get to the bottom of emotional cases. S8, Ep246

A woman accuses her ailing mother's neighbour of stealing from her mother's home, filing a false restraining order, and stalking. S16, Ep250
A woman is suing her upstairs neighbour for water damage to her home caused by a flood in her apartment; she is countersued for harassment. S16, Ep251
When a bicycle is hit by a car in a parking lot, the alleged wrongdoer blames the cyclist for not picking it up himself. S16, Ep252
A woman takes in a friend, her three children, her grandchild and a dog because they had no place to go; she insists they pay her back for their new beds. S16, Ep253
A woman claims her former friend illegally evicted her and her kids from his home and sues for damages. S16, Ep254
A man accuses his wife's aunt of illegally repossessing his truck; she is countersuing for damage to the truck, unpaid bills and the return of property. S16, Ep255
